title: Frederick P. Brooks Jr., Computer Design Innovator, Dies at 91
description: He was a lead designer of the computers that cemented IBM’s dominance for decades. He later wrote a book on software engineering that became a quirky classic.

title: Crypto Firm FTX’s Ownership of a U.S. Bank Raises Questions
description: Through a subsidiary, FTX invested $11.5 million in the parent company of Farmington State Bank, which has a single branch and, until this year, just three employees.

title: Why the NFL’s Big Streaming Deal Is Going Into Overtime
description: Talks for Sunday Ticket are expected to spill into next year, as Apple faces increased competition from Google for the league’s last available TV rights.

title: How to Make the Most of E-Books, and Find Free Ones
description: Even if you still love printed books, the digital option lets you put an entire library in your bag, just in time for holiday travel and vacation.

title: Lawsuit Takes Aim at the Way A.I. Is Built
description: A programmer is suing Microsoft, GitHub and OpenAI over artificial intelligence technology that generates its own computer code.

title: Can Sensor Technology Help Keep Office Workers Healthy?
description: The company OpenSensors uses small, inexpensive sensors to monitor air quality and other conditions in offices. The timing couldn’t be better.

title: Billions of Dollars at Stake in a Puzzling Holiday Shopping Season
description: It promises to be unpredictable, with retailers and consumers still figuring out how much will be spent and on what kinds of goods.
